purpose.summary: Establish clear guidelines for how leaves of absence (LOAs) affect incentive compensation to ensure compliance with federal and state leave laws, fair and consistent treatment of employees on leave, clear communication to affected employees, and proper calculation and payment procedures.
objectives: Compliance with federal and state leave laws
Fair and consistent treatment of employees on leave

appliesTo: All employees eligible for incentive compensation who take a leave of absence
FMLA (Family and Medical Leave Act) leave
exclusions: Unauthorized absence (absence without approval; may result in termination)

definitions.definition: Leaves protected by federal or state law including FMLA (up to 12 weeks), Military leave (USERRA), State-specific leave laws, and Disability leave (may be protected under ADA). Generally receive more favorable compensation treatment.
Leaves approved by the company that are not legally protected. Generally less favorable treatment than protected leaves; subject to company discretion.
Leave taken intermittently (e.g., 1 day per week for medical treatment). Quota adjusted based on total leave days.

provisions.title: Compensation Treatment by Leave Duration
provisions.content: Compensation treatment varies based on the duration of the leave of absence.

subProvisions.title: Short-Term Leave (<30 Days)
subProvisions.content: Remains eligible for incentive plan, continues to accrue performance credit. No adjustment to quota or goals. Paid on normal schedule based on performance.
items: No adjustment to quota or goals
Performance measured based on actual results
Paid on normal schedule based on performance
No reduction or pro-ration for leave period

subProvisions.title: Medium-Term Leave (30-90 Days)
subProvisions.content: Remains eligible for incentive plan during leave. Quota pro-rated based on active days. Adjusted Quota = Annual Quota x (Active Days / Total Days in Period).
items: Performance credit may be paused during leave; resumes upon return
Credit for in-flight deals closed during leave (if applicable to role)
Paid on normal schedule based on pro-rated quota
Attainment calculated: Actual Performance / Pro-Rated Quota

subProvisions.title: Long-Term Leave (>90 Days)
subProvisions.content: Suspended from incentive plan during leave period. Reinstated upon return to active status.
items: Quota suspended during leave
New quota assigned upon return (pro-rated for remaining period)
No credit for performance during leave period
Territory reassigned to interim coverage (if applicable)
No incentive payments during leave
Upon return: Participate in plan for remaining period with pro-rated quota
Earned incentive for periods worked prior to leave paid out per plan terms

provisions.title: FMLA Leave (Family & Medical Leave Act)
provisions.content: Up to 12 weeks unpaid leave with job protection and benefits continuation. Cannot penalize employee for taking FMLA.

subProvisions.title: Quota Adjustment
subProvisions.content: Pro-rate quota for periods >30 days on FMLA. Formula: Adjusted Annual Quota = Original Quota x [(365 - FMLA Days) / 365].
items: Eligible for payment based on pro-rated quota
Attainment calculated on adjusted quota
No penalty for taking FMLA leave
Must not discourage employees from taking FMLA
Quota pro-ration is permissible (employee not working)
Cannot reduce payout rate or change plan terms punitively

provisions.title: Parental Leave (Maternity, Paternity, Adoption)
provisions.content: Compensation treatment for paid and unpaid parental leave.

subProvisions.title: Paid Parental Leave (Company Benefit)
subProvisions.content: Quota pro-rated for time on leave >30 days. Eligible for incentive based on pro-rated quota.
items: Quota pro-rated for time on leave >30 days
Eligible for incentive based on pro-rated quota
In-flight deals: Credit to returning parent if closes within 30 days of return; otherwise to interim coverage

subProvisions.title: Unpaid Parental Leave (FMLA)
subProvisions.content: Treat per FMLA policy.

provisions.title: Military Leave (USERRA)
provisions.content: Job protection, benefits continuation, no adverse action due to military service.

subProvisions.title: Compensation Treatment
subProvisions.content: Quota pro-rated for military leave period. Upon return, reinstated with adjusted quota.
items: Pay earned incentive for periods worked before leave
Eligible to participate upon return
Cannot penalize for military service
Employee returns to same or similar position
Compensation plan participation restored
Pro-rated quota for remainder of year

provisions.title: Disability Leave (Short-Term & Long-Term)
provisions.content: Compensation treatment for short-term and long-term disability leaves.

subProvisions.title: Short-Term Disability (STD)
subProvisions.content: Typically <6 months.
items: Quota pro-rated if leave >30 days
Incentive paid based on pro-rated quota
Upon return, reinstated with adjusted quota for remaining period

subProvisions.title: Long-Term Disability (LTD)
subProvisions.content: Typically >6 months. LTD insurance provides income replacement. Incentive comp generally not included in LTD calculation (base salary only).
items: Suspended from active plan participation during LTD
No incentive payments during LTD period
If returns to work: Reinstated with pro-rated quota for remaining period
If unable to return: Treated per Termination Policy

subProvisions.title: Unpaid Personal Leave
subProvisions.content: Suspended from plan during leave. Quota pro-rated upon return. No credit for performance during leave.

subProvisions.title: Sabbatical (Paid Company Benefit)
subProvisions.content: Treat as short-term leave (<30 days) if sabbatical <=30 days. Quota pro-rated if sabbatical >30 days. Eligible for incentive based on pro-rated quota.

provisions.title: Communication to Employees on Leave
provisions.content: Communication requirements before, during, and after leave.

subProvisions.title: Before Leave Begins
subProvisions.content: HR & Manager must explain compensation impact and provide documentation.
items: Explain compensation impact (use this policy as reference)
Provide written summary of how leave affects comp
Calculate and communicate pro-rated quota (if applicable)
Explain payment timing
Answer employee questions
Provide copy of this policy, calculation showing pro-rated quota, expected payment schedule, contact for questions

subProvisions.title: During Leave
subProvisions.content: Minimal work-related communication during protected leave. Do not pressure employee about performance or return date.
items: If payment due while on leave, process normally
Provide participant statement explaining calculation

subProvisions.title: Upon Return
subProvisions.content: Reinstatement procedures when employee returns from leave.
items: Confirm return date with HR
Update employee status in ICMT (active)
Assign pro-rated quota for remaining period
Communicate new quota to employee
Welcome back and set expectations

provisions.title: Operational Procedures
provisions.content: Step-by-step procedures for handling leaves in the compensation system.

subProvisions.title: Employee Notifies of Leave
subProvisions.content: Three-step process when leave is initiated.
items: Step 1: HR Notification - Employee notifies HR of planned leave; HR determines leave type and eligibility
Step 2: HR Notifies Sales Operations within 2 business days with employee name, ID, leave type, start date, expected return date
Step 3: Sales Ops Updates Systems - Update ICMT employee status to On Leave, calculate pro-rated quota, suspend performance credit

subProvisions.title: During Leave
subProvisions.content: Monthly: HR provides Sales Ops with updated LOA list. Sales Ops verifies employee status in ICMT.
items: If payment due: Process payment per policy (based on pro-rated quota or prior period performance)
Send participant statement to employee

subProvisions.title: Employee Returns from Leave
subProvisions.content: Three-step return process.
items: Step 1: HR notifies Sales Ops of return date; confirm with employee
Step 2: Update ICMT status to Active; calculate pro-rated quota for remaining period; document quota adjustment
Step 3: Sales Ops sends welcome back email with quota info; Manager meets with employee to set expectations

provisions.title: Territory Coverage During Leave
provisions.content: If employee's territory needs coverage during leave.

subProvisions.title: Short-Term Leave (<30 days)
subProvisions.content: Manager or peers provide interim coverage. Credit goes to whoever closes the deal.

subProvisions.title: Medium/Long-Term Leave (>30 days)
subProvisions.content: Territory reassigned per Territory Change Procedures. In-flight deals per Crediting Rules Documentation. Upon return: Territory restored (or adjusted per business needs).

provisions.title: Special Situations
provisions.content: Handling of intermittent leave, extended leave, and multiple leaves.

subProvisions.title: Intermittent Leave
subProvisions.content: Calculate total leave days in period. Pro-rate quota based on total leave days. Formula: Adjusted Quota = Annual Quota x [(Total Days - Leave Days) / Total Days].

subProvisions.title: Leave Extending Beyond Expected Return
subProvisions.content: HR notifies Sales Ops of new expected return date. Sales Ops recalculates pro-rated quota. If employee does not return (termination): Treat per Termination Policy.

subProvisions.title: Multiple Leaves in One Year
subProvisions.content: Calculate cumulative leave days. Pro-rate quota based on total leave days. Treat each leave per policy based on type and duration.

provisions.title: Employee Rights
provisions.content: Employees on leave have specific rights regarding compensation treatment.

federalLaws: FMLA (Family & Medical Leave Act) - 12 weeks unpaid leave for qualifying reasons
USERRA (Uniformed Services Employment and Reemployment Rights Act)
stateLaws: State law may be more generous than federal; follow most generous
